titleInfo.title: 'File 36/7 Sabotage of American Petroleum Establishment in the Middle East'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 4; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file contains a copy of a letter sent from A C Stewart of the Foreign Office to Major A L A Dredge (Secretary to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bahrain) on 14 May 1948. The letter is a covering letter to an enclosed copy of another letter that was sent from Lewis Jones (American Embassy, London) to Lance F L Pyman of the Foreign Office on 11 May 1948. This letter concerns a report ('from a reliable source') that alleged that the Government of Russia had sent orders for the establishment of a network in the Middle East for the purpose of 'organising strikes, sabotage and technical accidents in American petroleum establishments in the Middle East'. The report named three individuals said to have been tasked with creating this network (Evssenko, Dimitry Ivanoff, and Boris Brodski) and claimed that they were currently in Beirut and headed to Cairo. The report also claimed that Ivanoff and Brodski were responsible for a strike at an Anglo-Iranian Oil Company station in Ahwaz, Iran in 1946. In the covering letter, Stewart states that there was no confirmation that they were the two individuals responsible for this strike.
